title: Commands Take Too Long (>10 Seconds)
content:
## Symptom

Commands (power on/off, input change, etc.) take more than 10 seconds to execute.

**Target:** Commands should complete in <5 seconds

## Diagnosis

1. Check History Panel timestamps
2. Note time between clicking button and success/failure
3. Compare to 5-second target

## Common Causes

**Network Issues:**
- Wi-Fi connection with high latency
- VPN routing traffic through distant servers
- Network congestion during peak hours
- Poor signal strength

**Projector Issues:**
- Old firmware (slow to respond)
- Projector overloaded with requests
- Compatibility issues

**Configuration Issues:**
- Timeout set too high (waiting unnecessarily)
- Too many retry attempts configured

## Solutions

### Quick Fixes

1. **Increase timeout** if commands are succeeding but slow:
   - Settings > Connection > Command Timeout
   - Set to 15 seconds
   - Gives projector more time to respond

2. **Reduce retries** if you want faster failures:
   - Settings > Connection > Retry attempts
   - Set to 1
   - Fails quickly instead of retrying

3. **Test network latency:**
   - Settings > Diagnostics > Run Network Test
   - Check ping time (should be <50ms)

### Long-Term Solutions

- **Use wired Ethernet** instead of Wi-Fi
- **Update projector firmware** (contact IT)
- **Avoid VPN** when controlling projectors
- **Schedule operations** during off-peak hours

> **Tip:** A combination of higher timeout (15s) and fewer retries (1-2) often provides the best balance.
